subject: Re: Install problem "Class not found "junit.samples.AllTests"
msgSnippet: I have the same problem,under windows 2003. I extracted it to c: junit,also extracted the junit.jar on the same folder.It is there as a file also. after
messageBody:
I have the same problem,under windows 2003.
I extracted it to c:\junit,also extracted the junit.jar on the same
folder.It is there as a file also.
after setting calsspath to
classpath=c:\junit\junit.jar;c:\junit

using the set command(i wonder if the path command in the system
properties is the same thing though!!!)

i get the following error:

C:\junit>java junit.textui.TestRunner junit.samples.AllTests
Class not found "junit.samples.AllTests"

C:\junit>

If i dont do the set classpath command i get

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError:
junit/textui/TestRunner


Any idea what am i doing wrong???
Any way that the set classpath command can be loaded at any time?
My junit is 3.8.1

Thank you for your time.
Hope there will be a solution.
Sincerely George




--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@r...>
wrote:
> Adrian Rutter wrote:
>
> > I've extracted the jUnit download into C:\JUnit. I've set the
CLASSPATH
> > "C:\jUnit\junit3.8.1\junit.jar;C:\jUnit"
> >
> > On the console I've gone to this dir "C:\jUnit\junit3.8.1" and
entered this
> >
> > java junit.awtui.TestRunner junit.samples.AllTests
> >
> > I receive this error:
> >
> > "Bootstrap: infestation error: couldn't get install directory"
> >
> > The TestRunner appears but an error msg is shown "Class not found
> > "junit.samples.AllTests"
> >
> > Can you help?
>
> Yes. JUnit is not installed at C:\jUnit; it is at
C:\jUnit\junit3.8.1.
> Put this second path on your CLASSPATH instead of C:\jUnit.
> --
> J. B. Rainsberger,
> Diaspar Software Services
> http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
> Let's write software that people understand
